intro: Hypocalyptus oxalidifolius, commonly known as the red-stemmed oxalid, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and knotweeds. The plant is characterized by its distinctive red stems and trifoliate leaves that resemble those of the oxalis genus. Its small, greenish-white flowers appear in clusters and bloom in the spring. The species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
